intro: Loxanisa atrata, commonly known as the black loxanisa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are often lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Loxanisa atrata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
